newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures end mixed in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures end mixed in thin trade.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures ended mixed in thin trade on Monday as market players retreated to the sidelines ahead of the spot expiry on Friday, traders said.
Prices ranged from 0.9 yen per kg lower to 0.5 yen firmer. Benchmark March was up 0.5 yen at 136.4 yen.
Activity was mainly dominated by position-adjustment trade, with prices drifting within ranges in directionless trade.

"Market players believed it would be risky to make fresh buying as bumper rubber stocks cast a shadow on the market, while lower prices here relative to producing countries and a weak yen made players cautious of selling," one trader said.
